answers.text: to saturate broken ("dangling") bonds of amorphous silicon and amorphous carbon that helps stabilizing material properties

qas.question: How is hydrogen used in oxide materials?
What oxide materials use hydrogen as an electron donor?

answers.text: ZnO, SnO2, CdO, MgO, ZrO2, HfO2, La2O3, Y2O3, TiO2, SrTiO3, LaAlO3, SiO2, Al2O3, ZrSiO4, HfSiO4, and SrZrO3

context: Hydrogen is employed <a0_0>to saturate broken ("dangling") bonds of amorphous silicon and amorphous carbon that helps stabilizing material properties<a0_0/>. It is also <a1_0>a potential electron donor<a1_0/> in various oxide materials, including <a2_0>ZnO, SnO2, CdO, MgO, ZrO2, HfO2, La2O3, Y2O3, TiO2, SrTiO3, LaAlO3, SiO2, Al2O3, ZrSiO4, HfSiO4, and SrZrO3<a2_0/>.
